text:
"The message is bigger than the businesses."

Unrest in Minneapolis following the death of George Floyd has resulted in numerous buildings being burned down. Brandy Moore’s stores were among them. https://t.co/aW3ETwZrj8

name: NBCNews
text:
Latinos denounce police violence as they protest George Floyd's death.

"You don’t need to be black to see how horrible it is,” a protester who is the son of Mexican immigrants says, “With more police accountability, that will help us, too.” https://t.co/ZjbbkrMl1I - @NBCLatino

name: NBCNews
text: The organizers of the annual LA Pride Festival and Parade announced they would revive their June 14 centerpiece event as a "solidarity protest march" with the black community "in response to racial injustice, systemic racism, and all forms of oppression." https://t.co/A3GX4fKejz

name: NBCNews
text: “EVERYTHING IN MY STORE WILL BE REPLACEABLE,” one shop owner wrote, “while lives are being senselessly lost, on a way too regular basis, is the way bigger issue.” - @NBCAsianAmerica https://t.co/NgA4KHX8V1
